definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: He set a post in the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他在地上樹起了一根杆子。

sentences.english: The jowar stalks collapsed into the mud and the grain turned black.
sentences.chinese: 高粱杆子倒在泥地裏，穗粒兒變黑了。

sentences.english: So it's like a skateboard with a stick?
sentences.chinese: 看起來像是加了根杆子的滑板？

sentences.english: Wrap it halfway around the pole or timber.
sentences.chinese: 將它在杆子或木頭上環繞半圈。

sentences.english: He kept probing the crusty snow with a pole.
sentences.chinese: 他老是用一根杆子探測硬雪。

sentences.english: Shep found the staff glowing brighter and brighter.
sentences.chinese: 三浦發現手中的杆子在發光，光芒越來越強烈。

sentences.english: "Pole men" would collect it in vats, carried on a pole.
sentences.chinese: “竿子工”會將其收集進缸子裏，而用杆子挑着缸子。

sentences.english: No, our Date Local movement won't be overbearing.
sentences.chinese: 於是，我們的本地戀運動不會一杆子打。

sentences.english: I can't get the pole to stand up.
The truth struck me when I saw the pale-colored cane beside him.
sentences.chinese: 見到他身旁有支塗了顏色的杆子時，我十分震驚。

sentences.english: There stands a tall pole on the hill.
sentences.chinese: 在山上立着一根高高的杆子。

sentences.english: Imagine you have a rod through your back and bottom and keep them in alignment.
sentences.chinese: 想象從你的後背到腳綁在一根杆子上。

sentences.english: He's a cousin many times removed.
sentences.chinese: 他是我八杆子打不着的親戚。

sentences.english: Young Griff extended him a pole.
sentences.chinese: 小格里夫伸給他一根杆子。

sentences.english: Teenage boys clamber down mine shafts 30 to 50 meters deep.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們沿着杆子爬到深30到50米的礦井裏。

definition: wooden club (used to beat clothes in washing)
stick/pole/lever/classifier for long objects such as guns
